short_description: This function computes closeness and k-degree scores for each specified source vertex.
long_description: The function works on directed and undirected graphs to compute closeness and k-degree.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the target key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify targets_table, then the function uses only the vertices in targets_table as targets (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the target key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify targets_table, then the function uses only the vertices in targets_table as targets (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies).

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: EdgeWeight
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains edge weights. The weights are positive values. By default, the weight of each edge is 1 (that is, the graph is unweighted).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains edge weights. The weights are positive values. By default, the weight of each edge is 1 (that is, the graph is unweighted).

argument_clauses.name: SampleRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the sample rate (the percentage of source vertices to sample), a numeric value in the range (0, 1]. The default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the sample rate (the percentage of source vertices to sample), a numeric value in the range (0, 1]. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: MaxDistance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum distance between source and target for which the function outputs the vertices. The max_distance must be an integer. If max_distance is negative, the distance between source and target is unbounded. The default is value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum distance between source and target for which the function outputs the vertices. The max_distance must be an integer. If max_distance is negative, the distance between source and target is unbounded. The default is value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: Directed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the graph is directed. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the graph is directed. The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: GroupSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of source vertices that execute a single-node shortest path (SNSP) algorithm in parallel. If group_size exceeds the number of source vertices in a partition, then the number of source vertices in the partition is the group size. By default, the function uses cluster and query characteristics to determine the optimal group size.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of source vertices that execute a single-node shortest path (SNSP) algorithm in parallel. If group_size exceeds the number of source vertices in a partition, then the number of source vertices in the partition is the group size. By default, the function uses cluster and query characteristics to determine the optimal group size.
